page.title: 02HURSTBOURNE TARRANT-VILLAGE
page.content: {Hurstbourne Tarrant}is a village in North Hampshire. There has been a village here since Saxon times.People settled here because there was water and it was a place where several routes crossed. At the bottom of the hill to the south of the village, near the bridge over the bourne, there are two Sarcen stones. A long time ago the whole valley was marshy, and these stones would have shown travellers where to cross the marsh. They might have been used as stepping stones. You can see where the road has been built up to cross the bridge. The hill used to be even steeper than it is now.
